c74object.name: nw.gverb~
c74object.description: Processes the audio input to produce two-channels of de-correlated reverb output. This stereo reverb is in the style of those designed by David Griesinger of Lexicon, which were detailed in Jon Dattorroâ€™s September 1997 AES article. Be aware that this object only generates the wet signal, therefore you must add the dry back into the mix yourself.

objarg.name: decay-time
objarg.digest: Initial reverb decay time in milliseconds.

method.name: float
method.description: In right inlet: Numbers can be used instead of signal objects to reverb decay time. If a signal is also connected to the inlet, float messages will be ignored. Any numbers sent to the left inlet will be ignored.

method.name: int
method.description: In right inlet: Numbers can be used instead of signal objects to reverb decay time. If a signal is also connected to the inlet, int messages will be ignored. Any numbers sent to the left inlet will be ignored.

method.name: signal
method.description:
In left inlet: Dry signal to be processed for wet reverb output.
In right inlet: Specifies the reverb decay time in milliseconds. Note that a signal attached to this inlet will cause the reverb parameters to be re-computed every sample, resulting in higher CPU usage.

method.name: getinfo
method.digest: Post information about object to Max window
method.description: Retrieves basic information about the object author and when the object was last updated. Date can be used to identify different versions of the objects in circulation.
